article.abstract: With the growth of complex multiprocessor system-on-chip design and the evolution of process technology, it is crucial to address thermal issues owing to the high power density of chips. Electronic system level (ESL) design is an acknowledged effective methodology to explore system design by virtual platforms (VPs) at the early stages of integrated circuit (IC) design. Therefore, power- and thermal-aware VPs at the ESL are required to explore the thermal issues at the early stages of IC design. Current VPs at the ESL are less discussed in the thermal issues. Therefore, we propose a methodology to easily develop VPs from power awareness to power and thermal awareness. In the methodology, a refined thermal engine that has lower computational complexity is proposed to analyse the heat of ICs, and it has high compatibility for integration with power-aware VPs. In addition, the thermal analysis in the methodology considers the thermal effects of leakage power consumption to reflect the physical temperature of ICs. Thus, system designers can utilize the proposed methodology to easily develop their power-aware VPs into power- and thermal-aware VPs.

email_sent.body:
Dear Dr. Kumar
CPS-2017-0066.R2
Methodology for developing virtual platforms from power-aware to power- and thermal-aware at electronic system level
Lu, Liang-Ying; Hsieh, Tsung-Yu; Weng, Pei-En; Chiou, lih-Yih
I am writing to you on behalf of Prof. Dr. Shiyan Hu and Albert Zomaya in their capacity as Editor-in-Chief of IET Cyber-Physical Systems: Theory & Applications. The above paper was accepted subject to revisions and has now been revised and resubmitted to the journal. As the original reviewers of this manuscript are unable to review the revised version, I would appreciate it if you could look at the revised version and tell me whether you believe the paper is now acceptable for publication. Please do not introduce new comments at this stage. If you feel there are fundamental errors in this paper please highlight these in your comments to the editor. We would be grateful if you could return your report within 2 weeks.
To accept the assignment, please click on the link below. The full paper will be made available to you, together with details of how to review it, once you have accepted the request. You can view the original reviewers’ comments and the author's response within the revised manuscript file.
Thank you in advance for your help.
Hayley Faulkner IET Cyber-Physical Systems: Theory & Applications Editorial Office
Abstract With the growth of complex multiprocessor system-on-chip design and the evolution of process technology, it is crucial to address thermal issues owing to the high power density of chips. Electronic system level (ESL) design is an acknowledged effective methodology to explore system design by virtual platforms (VPs) at the early stages of integrated circuit (IC) design. Therefore, power- and thermal-aware VPs at the ESL are required to explore the thermal issues at the early stages of IC design. Current VPs at the ESL are less discussed in the thermal issues. Therefore, we propose a methodology to easily develop VPs from power awareness to power and thermal awareness. In the methodology, a refined thermal engine that has lower computational complexity is proposed to analyse the heat of ICs, and it has high compatibility for integration with power-aware VPs. In addition, the thermal analysis in the methodology considers the thermal effects of leakage power consumption to reflect the physical temperature of ICs. Thus, system designers can utilize the proposed methodology to easily develop their power-aware VPs into power- and thermal-aware VPs.
